intro: Triglochin ciliata, commonly known as the hairy spikerush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its cylindrical, grass-like stems and is often found in wetland habitats such as marshes and pond edges. The plant produces small, spike-like clusters of flowers, which are typically greenish or reddish in color. Its leaves are narrow and have a hairy texture, contributing to its common name. Triglochin ciliata is adapted to moist environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in aquatic and semi-aquatic ecosystems.
